candidates.name: Andy Asquith
candidates.why_elect: Local government is my passion. I bring a wealth of experience and knowledge on local government. I have served as a local body employee, have previously been a candidate and have served on the equivalent of a local board. I also have a wealth of governance experience on community organisations.
candidates.why_stand: I am passionate about good local government. My career has been spent researching, writing, educating and commenting on local government. I want to use my professional expertise to enhance the good work already being done by Palmerston North City Council in order to take Palmerston North from good to great!

candidates.name: Maruna Engu
candidates.why_elect: Over 20 year of hospitalities customer services. Bricklaying Business; Sanitarium Sales Rep; Senior Kiwisaver consultant for Huljich Wealth Management won two awards; MiCiti Ltd; Highbury Flea-Market; a Papa Engu Donuts stall. Volunteer PARS Treasurer, Pasifika Trust Secretary, COGS Vice Chair, Cook Island Vice Chair and member of interfaith Group.
candidates.why_stand: My concern for the prospect future of my children and understanding my duty of care as a father to my family to stand up and speak which is our highest calling. The grass root problem is council have forgotten their duty of love and care. Vote my city that cares.

candidates.name: Teanau Tuiono
candidates.why_elect: I am used to leading and facilitating diverse perspectives. From working with communities in remote rainforests to working with diplomats at the UN. I am also a familiar face in our local art and activism scene because it is important to me to be also active where I live.
candidates.why_stand: For me Palmerston North is like the Wood Between the Worlds in the Narnia stories. I have made so many different and diverse connections here that I am continuously surprised by the place and people. Magical? Maybe.
